00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_odb_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_odb_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 #include "odb_backend.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * @file git2/odb.h
00035  * @brief Git object database routines
00036  * @defgroup git_odb Git object database routines
00037  * @ingroup Git
00038  * @{
00039  */
00040 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Create a new object database with no backends.
00044  *
00045  * Before the ODB can be used for read/writing, a custom database
00046  * backend must be manually added using `git_odb_add_backend()`
00047  *
00048  * @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
00049  *            Set to NULL if the open failed.
00050  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database was created; otherwise an error
00051  *         code describing why the open was not possible.
00052  */
00053 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_new(git_odb **out);
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * Create a new object database and automatically add
00057  * the two default backends:
00058  *
00059  *      - git_odb_backend_loose: read and write loose object files
00060  *              from disk, assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder
00061  *
00062  *      - git_odb_backend_pack: read objects from packfiles,
00063  *              assuming `objects_dir` as the Objects folder which
00064  *              contains a 'pack/' folder with the corresponding data
00065  *
00066  * @param out location to store the database pointer, if opened.
00067  *            Set to NULL if the open failed.
00068  * @param objects_dir path of the backends' "objects" directory.
00069  * @return GIT_SUCCESS if the database opened; otherwise an error
00070  *         code describing why the open was not possible.
00071  */
00072 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_open(git_odb **out, const char *objects_dir);
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * Add a custom backend to an existing Object DB
00076  *
00077  * Read <odb_backends.h> for more information.
00078  *
00079  * @param odb database to add the backend to
00080  * @paramm backend pointer to a git_odb_backend instance
00081  * @return 0 on sucess; error code otherwise
00082  */
00083 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_add_backend(git_odb *odb, git_odb_backend *backend, int priority);
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * Add a custom backend to an existing Object DB; this
00087  * backend will work as an alternate.
00088  *
00089  * Alternate backends are always checked for objects *after*
00090  * all the main backends have been exhausted.
00091  *
00092  * Writing is disabled on alternate backends.
00093  *
00094  * Read <odb_backends.h> for more information.
00095  *
00096  * @param odb database to add the backend to
00097  * @paramm backend pointer to a git_odb_backend instance
00098  * @return 0 on sucess; error code otherwise
00099  */
00100 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_add_alternate(git_odb *odb, git_odb_backend *backend, int priority);
00101 
00102 /**
00103  * Close an open object database.
00104  *
00105  * @param db database pointer to close.  If NULL no action is taken.
00106  */
00107 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_odb_close(git_odb *db);
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Read an object from the database.
00111  *
00112  * This method queries all avaiable ODB backends
00113  * trying to read the given OID.
00114  *
00115  * The returned object is reference counted and
00116  * internally cached, so it should be closed
00117  * by the user once it's no longer in use.
00118  *
00119  * @param out pointer where to store the read object
00120  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00121  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00122  * @return
00123  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
00124  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00125  */
00126 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_read(git_odb_object **out, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00127 
00128 /**
00129  * Read the header of an object from the database, without
00130  * reading its full contents.
00131  *
00132  * The header includes the length and the type of an object.
00133  *
00134  * Note that most backends do not support reading only the header
00135  * of an object, so the whole object will be read and then the
00136  * header will be returned.
00137  *
00138  * @param len_p pointer where to store the length
00139  * @param type_p pointer where to store the type
00140  * @param db database to search for the object in.
00141  * @param id identity of the object to read.
00142  * @return
00143  * - GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
00144  * - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.
00145  */
00146 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_read_header(size_t *len_p, git_otype *type_p, git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00147 
00148 /**
00149  * Determine if the given object can be found in the object database.
00150  *
00151  * @param db database to be searched for the given object.
00152  * @param id the object to search for.
00153  * @return
00154  * - 1, if the object was found
00155  * - 0, otherwise
00156  */
00157 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_exists(git_odb *db, const git_oid *id);
00158 
00159 /**
00160  * Write an object directly into the ODB
00161  *
00162  * This method writes a full object straight into the ODB.
00163  * For most cases, it is preferred to write objects through a write
00164  * stream, which is both faster and less memory intensive, specially
00165  * for big objects.
00166  *
00167  * This method is provided for compatibility with custom backends
00168  * which are not able to support streaming writes
00169  *
00170  * @param oid pointer to store the OID result of the write
00171  * @param odb object database where to store the object
00172  * @param data buffer with the data to storr
00173  * @param len size of the buffer
00174  * @param type type of the data to store
00175  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00176  */
00177 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_write(git_oid *oid, git_odb *odb, const void *data, size_t len, git_otype type);
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * Open a stream to write an object into the ODB
00181  *
00182  * The type and final length of the object must be specified
00183  * when opening the stream.
00184  *
00185  * The returned stream will be of type `GIT_STREAM_WRONLY` and
00186  * will have the following methods:
00187  *      
00188  *              - stream->write: write `n` bytes into the stream
00189  *              - stream->finalize_write: close the stream and store the object in
00190  *                      the odb
00191  *              - stream->free: free the stream
00192  * 
00193  * The streaming write won't be effective until `stream->finalize_write`
00194  * is called and returns without an error
00195  *
00196  * The stream must always be free'd or will leak memory.
00197  *
00198  * @see git_odb_stream
00199  *
00200  * @param stream pointer where to store the stream
00201  * @param db object database where the stream will write
00202  * @param size final size of the object that will be written
00203  * @param type type of the object that will be written
00204  * @return 0 if the stream was created; error code otherwise
00205  */
00206 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_open_wstream(git_odb_stream **stream, git_odb *db, size_t size, git_otype type);
00207 
00208 /**
00209  * Open a stream to read an object from the ODB
00210  *
00211  * Note that most backends do *not* support streaming reads
00212  * because they store their objects as compressed/delta'ed blobs.
00213  *
00214  * It's recommended to use `git_odb_read` instead, which is
00215  * assured to work on all backends.
00216  *
00217  * The returned stream will be of type `GIT_STREAM_RDONLY` and
00218  * will have the following methods:
00219  *      
00220  *              - stream->read: read `n` bytes from the stream
00221  *              - stream->free: free the stream
00222  *
00223  * The stream must always be free'd or will leak memory.
00224  *
00225  * @see git_odb_stream
00226  *
00227  * @param stream pointer where to store the stream
00228  * @param db object database where the stream will read from
00229  * @param oid oid of the object the stream will read from
00230  * @return 0 if the stream was created; error code otherwise
00231  */
00232 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_open_rstream(git_odb_stream **stream, git_odb *db, const git_oid *oid);
00233 
00234 /**
00235  * Determine the object-ID (sha1 hash) of a data buffer
00236  *
00237  * The resulting SHA-1 OID will the itentifier for the data
00238  * buffer as if the data buffer it were to written to the ODB.
00239  *
00240  * @param id the resulting object-ID.
00241  * @param data data to hash
00242  * @param len size of the data
00243  * @param type of the data to hash
00244  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00245  */
00246 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_odb_hash(git_oid *id, const void *data, size_t len, git_otype type);
00247 
00248 /**
00249  * Close an ODB object
00250  *
00251  * This method must always be called once a `git_odb_object` is no
00252  * longer needed, otherwise memory will leak.
00253  *
00254  * @param object object to close
00255  */
00256 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_odb_object_close(git_odb_object *object);
00257 
00258 /**
00259  * Return the OID of an ODB object
00260  *
00261  * This is the OID from which the object was read from
00262  *
00263  * @param object the object
00264  * @return a pointer to the OID
00265  */
00266 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_odb_object_id(git_odb_object *object);
00267 
00268 /**
00269  * Return the data of an ODB object
00270  *
00271  * This is the uncompressed, raw data as read from the ODB,
00272  * without the leading header.
00273  *
00274  * This pointer is owned by the object and shall not be free'd.
00275  *
00276  * @param object the object
00277  * @return a pointer to the data
00278  */
00279 GIT_EXTERN(const void *) git_odb_object_data(git_odb_object *object);
00280 
00281 /**
00282  * Return the size of an ODB object
00283  *
00284  * This is the real size of the `data` buffer, not the
00285  * actual size of the object.
00286  *
00287  * @param object the object
00288  * @return the size
00289  */
00290 GIT_EXTERN(size_t) git_odb_object_size(git_odb_object *object);
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * Return the type of an ODB object
00294  *
00295  * @param object the object
00296  * @return the type
00297  */
00298 GIT_EXTERN(git_otype) git_odb_object_type(git_odb_object *object);
00299 
00300 /** @} */
00301 GIT_END_DECL
00302 #endif
